definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: We share the same roots, it is only nature that Dr. Sun's disciples should wear the mandarin suits.
sentences.chinese: 中山先生的傳人都穿中山裝，那是再自然不過的了。

sentences.english: Since then, the prevalence of Chinese tunic suit going on for almost 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 從那時開始，中山裝的流行持續了近30年的時間。

sentences.english: Pullover tunic flaunts a point collar and open half placket.
sentences.chinese: 套衫中山裝標榜點衣領和開半門襟。

sentences.english: He wore a familiar Mao-style khaki jumpsuit and dark sunglasses.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着人們熟悉的卡其色中山裝，戴着墨鏡。

sentences.english: Nowadays, Zhongshan Suit and Qipao have become the representatives of Chinese men and women clothing.
sentences.chinese: 如今中山裝和旗袍已經成爲我國男女服裝的代表。

sentences.english: This was the original Zhongshan Suit.
A fashionable pullover tunic with faux-fur trim at the neckline and collar.
sentences.chinese: 與人造毛皮裝飾的時尚套頭毛衣的領口和領中山裝。

sentences.english: Zhongshan Suit gained the name because Sun Zhongshan is the first to wear it.
sentences.chinese: 中山裝是因孫中山先生率先穿用而得名。

sentences.english: Under the key word "Yi Fu" (clothing) is a picture of the pants and jacket known the world over as a Mao suit.
sentences.chinese: 在“衣服”詞條下是一張中山裝的照片。

definition: buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
to keep up with the latest fashion
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
crew neck/round neck (of pull-over garment, e.g. T-shirt)
